intro: Amaracarpus pubescens subsp. sechellarum, commonly known as the Seychelles amaracarpus, is a flowering plant native to the Seychelles. It belongs to the family Arecaceae, which includes palms, and is characterized by its slender, unbranched stem. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. Its leaves are long and pinnately compound, with a hairy texture that gives it its subspecies name. This species is adapted to coastal and limestone habitats, showing resilience to saline and dry conditions.
